Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CRAMP-18 E2K (Lys-rich; synthetic AMPs, analog of CRAMP-18, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (94.44%) toCRAMP-1In this variant, E2 of CRAMP-18 is changed to K2. K: 39%.Activity: CRAMP-18 E2K is active against E. coli KCTC 1682 (MIC 3.12 uM), S. typhimurium KCTC 1926 (MIC 1.56 uM), P. aeruginosa KCTC 1637 (MIC 0.78 uM), B. subtilis KCTC 1918 (MIC 3.12 uM), S. pyogenes KCTC 3096 (MIC 3.12 uM), S. aureus KCTC 1621 (MIC 1.56 uM), C. albicans (MIC 6.25 uM), A. fumigatus (MIC 12.5 uM), tumor cells: A549 (IC50 25 uM), K562 (IC50 34 uM), Jurkat (IC50 20 uM).Toxicity: 0% hemolysis at 100 uM (not hemo.lytic).Structure: random coil in water, helical in 50% TFE.
Literature Information.Author: Shin SY, Kang SW, Lee DG, Eom SH, Song WK, Kim JI. 2000
Literature Information.Reference: Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2000 Sep 7;275(3):904-9. doi: 10.1006/bbrc.2000.3269.Pub-Med.
Literature Information.Title: CRAMP analogues having potent antibiotic activity against bacterial, fungal, and tumor cells without hemolytic activity.
